metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15999 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
Heap buffer overflow in Freetype in Google Chrome prior to 86.0.4240.111 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freetype2-demos - 2.5.2-1ubuntu2.8+esm2
libfreetype6 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu2.8+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: android: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
freetype package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-1ubuntu2.8+esm2').
